alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 1:46AM CDT until October 26 at 4:20PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 88.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Ball fields at Moss Park are completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 86.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 84.0 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 84.7 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this morning. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
